intro: Anderbergia elsiae, commonly known as the Elsie's sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ability to store water in its leaves make it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Anderbergia elsiae is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal dunes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
